subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ad for Ebay
author: psfponies
full_text:
--0-2082299103-1207623589=:22524
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Margaret 
   
  Yes I saw what Frank and Bruce wrote I am taking it all in, trying to figure the best way to handle this. I know some are opposed to doing anything and some are for it. And of course being a newbie to both the group and evps I respect what everyone has to say. 
   
  Think I am going to sleep on it and look more into it tomorrow. And as a group figure out what is best for all.  I think I personally got caught up in the hype of seeing someone sticking it to so many people. 
   
  Kay

itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wrote:
  Hi Kay. Just wanting to make sure you saw Frank's post. His concern being that we might 
wipe out the 12-469 availability. Maybe you could mention all the models, or none of 
them (just be more generic in the ad). This way, people can be drawn to one model or 
another naturally, rather than being guided toward the 12-469 (which honestly, I think the 
click-click-clicking on the new version is a distraction). 

If I were to start from scratch, looking at all the choices, I would have gone with the 12-
820 first. It's great that additional models have been discovered to be hackable. Thanks 
much to those who have brought this information to our attention!

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psfponies" 
wrote:
>
> Here is a mock ad I made to put up on ebay. Let me know what you 
> think and please any addtional information or editing on the ad is 
> welcome. I will also put it on craiglist or anywhere else that will 
> be helpful ...
> 
> Kay
> 
> 
> 
> MAKE YOUR OWN GHOST BOX
> 
> You can make your own Ghost box that functions similar to a Frank's 
> box, Joe's box and the Mini box. All you need to do is go to your 
> local Radio Shack and pick up the 12-469 Digital AM/FM Pocket Radio 
> for ONLY $24.99 plus tax and with a simple modification. You will 
> have your very own cheap alternative to a "GHOST BOX".
> 
> (I will insert a picture of the RS 12-469 here)
> 
> 
> This simple modification lets the radio sweep both the AM and FM 
> band. Instead of it scanning and stopping on a station, doing the 
> modification (clipping the "Mute" pin) lets it just sweep the entire 
> band, without stopping on any station. Just hook your Radio up to 
> some speakers or headphones and while the radio is sweeping the 
> bands start asking questions and get answers in real time. You can 
> also record it and review it later for answers you may have missed.
> 
> There are several sites for the FREE instructions on how to modify 
> your Radio Shack 12-469.
> 
> http://ufogeek.com/?p=81
> 
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ozhaY1fW3s4 part 1
> 
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O2ZLABu0rK0 part 2
> 
> For more information from the "Experts" on Ghost Boxes and EVPS you 
> can also go to:
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/
> 
> Good luck and happy ghost hunting!!!!!!!!!!
>




------------------------------------

Yahoo! Groups Links





       
---------------------------------
You rock. That's why Blockbuster's offering you one month of Blockbuster Total Access, No Cost.
